page.title: 05Health
page.content: The effects of good housing, clean air and active life-styles combine to create an enviroment in which such health problems as exist at LINDEAN are mainly associated with old age.A local Health Centre staffed by four general practitioners,district nurses, auxiliaries and office workers is located in Selkirk, which also possesses a small cottage hospital mainly for geriatric and chronic cases .A general hospital,originally a military hospital serving the Borders Region is shortly to be replaced by a modern hospital on a site near Melrose.All of these provisions are adminstered by the Border Health Board which also controls a hospital for the mentally sick and a college for nursing. Specialist nursing and treatment are provided by arrangement with hospitals in Edinburgh.
